thread.title_full: Women's March organizers now planning a 'General Strike' | Daily Mail Online

author: Nikki Schwab
title: Women's March organizers now planning a 'General Strike' | Daily Mail Online
text: comments The organizers of the Women's March on Washington, have another idea for a mass protest up their sleeves. The Twitter account for the Women's March announced today a 'General Strike: A Day Without A Woman,' noting that the date was still to be announced. A general strikes involves a large portion of the population walking out of various workplaces, instead of just a singular company. Scroll down for video The organizers of the Women's March now want women to leave the workforce for the day, to make their impact palatable Women's Marches around the country attracted participants numbers in the millions, which means organizers may have enough momentum to pull off a large scale general strike In Washington, women marched in President Donald Trump's backyard, near the Washington Monument In this case, women would vanish from the workplace for a day. According to CNN's reporting , organizers would also push participants to boycott certain businesses. Boycotts in recent weeks have lead to companies pulling away from the Trump brand. Uber's CEO Travis Kalanick was forced to abandon a spot on the president's economic council after activists pushed a #DeleteUber campaign. The ride-share company also looked like they weren't on board a protest at the John F. Kennedy airport in New York City on the heels of President Donald Trump executing the seven-country travel ban. More than 200,000 customers deleted their accounts, reported the New York Times . RELATED ARTICLES
